      double[][] findTestWeights()
      Finds Test Weights finds the weights by multiplying normalised array with eigenvectors saved into new array which is then summed to find the weights for each image these weights are saved into a new array
      double[][] findWeights()
      Finds Weights finds the weights by multiplying normalised array with eigenvectors saved into new array which is then summed to find the weights for each image these weights are saved into a new array
      double matchEuclidean()
      Match Euclidean Distance finds the distane between the training weights with the test weights using Euclidean distance
      double matchManhattan()
      Match Manhattan Distance finds the distane between the training weights with the test weights using Manhattan distance
      double matchMinkowski()
      Match Minkowski^3 Distance finds the distane between the training weights with the test weights using Minkowski^3 distance
      double matchMinkowski4()
      Match Minkowski^4 Distance finds the distane between the training weights with the test weights using Minkowski^4 distance
      double[][] normaliseArray()
      Normalise array The array from the read image method is then normalised Average row value is found in the first loop and stored in array so can be employed later The average row value is then subtracted from the respected row
      double[][] normaliseTestArray()
      Normalise array The array from the read test image method is then normalised with the averages calculated in normalise array method
      double[][] readImage1​(java.lang.String filename)
      Read Image Each image in read using getRGB, the values are then added to a column The array is then filled out with different images
      double[][] readTestImage​(java.lang.String filename)
      Read Test Image Test image is read using getRGB, the values are then added to a column
      double[][] SVD()
      SVD Uses Jamas SVD to return the eigenvectors in pc array Normalised array needs to be converted to matrix and back to array

        Read Image Each image in read using getRGB, the values are then added to a column The array is then filled out with different images

        Returns:

      • normaliseArray

        public double[][] normaliseArray()
        Normalise array The array from the read image method is then normalised Average row value is found in the first loop and stored in array so can be employed later The average row value is then subtracted from the respected row
        Returns:
        normalised array

      • SVD

        public double[][] SVD()
        SVD Uses Jamas SVD to return the eigenvectors in pc array Normalised array needs to be converted to matrix and back to array
        Returns:
        eigenvectors array

      • findWeights

        public double[][] findWeights()
        Finds Weights finds the weights by multiplying normalised array with eigenvectors saved into new array which is then summed to find the weights for each image these weights are saved into a new array
        Returns:
        double array of weights

      • readTestImage

        public double[][] readTestImage​(java.lang.String filename)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Read Test Image Test image is read using getRGB, the values are then added to a column
        Parameters:
        String - - the test file input
        Returns:
        Array of the rgb values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • normaliseTestArray

        public double[][] normaliseTestArray()
        Normalise array The array from the read test image method is then normalised with the averages calculated in normalise array method
        Returns:
        normalised test array

      • findTestWeights

        public double[][] findTestWeights()
        Finds Test Weights finds the weights by multiplying normalised array with eigenvectors saved into new array which is then summed to find the weights for each image these weights are saved into a new array
        Returns:
        double array of test weights

      • matchEuclidean

        public double matchEuclidean()
        Match Euclidean Distance finds the distane between the training weights with the test weights using Euclidean distance
        Returns:
        double training image that has the shortest distance to test image
